alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Merrick; Nance; Polk; York (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 1:30AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Nance, northern York, northeastern Hamilton, northeastern Merrick and Polk Counties through 215 AM CDT... At 130 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles north of Monroe to near Silver Creek to 6 miles northeast of Polk to near Hordville. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Stromsburg around 140 AM CDT. Osceola around 145 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Shelby, Benedict and Gresham. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for south central and central Nebraska.
